{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3536785,"name":"Javaru","username":"Javaru","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/javaru/{size}/6589_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T23:38:13.602Z","cooked":"

We’re getting some weird behavior in our YAGSL swerve drive. While investigating, I found a contradiction in the YAGSL documentation. In the JSON Modules section on the Swerve Drive Configuration page, the documentation for the modules array property states:

Module JSONs in order clockwise order starting from front left.

However, right below that statement, in the example, the file names for the modules are not in clockwise order:

{
  . . .
  "modules": [
    "frontleft.json",
    "frontright.json",
    "backleft.json",
    "backright.json"
  ]
}

What is shown is more of a Z pattern than clockwise order. The swervedrive.json file in the YAGSL-Example project also use this Z pattern. Clockwise order would have the two back modules in the opposite order:

  "modules": [
    "frontleft.json", 
    "frontright.json",
    "backright.json",
    "backleft.json"
  ]

Which is the correct order?

@nstrike Can we look into this?

@Javaru have you asked for help in the YAGSL Discord? thats the best place to get help quickly

Great find in the docs! Yes it is a mistake and i wasn’t sure how to correct it. We had discussed this somewhere else in CD but didn’t come to a consensus on how it should be described it does need to change.

It should be FL, FR, BL, BR bc this is how i test but it might not matter. So the truth is I DONT KNOW!

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T01:30:37.468Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":53,"readers_count":52,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492774,"topic_slug":"yagsl-documentation-contradiction","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/yagsl-documentation-contradiction/492774/3","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536945,"name":"Javaru","username":"Javaru","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/javaru/{size}/6589_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T03:24:23.950Z","cooked":"

Thanks. The main issue for us was one part of our code accesses SwerveDrive.getModules() and it assumed clockwise ordering when accessing the modules. This caused the back modules to be switched in that one spot compared to what was the reality and what YAGSL is doing.

As for the docs, I personally think keeping it simple and just saying “an array in the order: front-left, front-right, back-left, back-right” is fine. Another consideration, for next year, is to get rid of the array, and its potential confusion and error due to ordering, and use a Java record (or a simple POJO) so each module has a name. Have it implement Iterable so the modules can be iterated over in a for loop as needed in a consistent order. Just a thought.

Thanks again for the assistance and for all your work on YAGSL.
